BEST FOR · E-COMMERCE

Most AI Builders Can't Build Real Stores

T-shirt store with 12 designs × 5 sizes × 4 colors = 240 variants. Framer can't handle it (would need 240 separate products). 10Web + WooCommerce handles it automatically. 2 hours vs 40 hours setup. Choose wrong and you're rebuilding in 3 months.

MY EXPERIENCE

The 240-Variant Nightmare:
Why Framer Failed My Store

THE BEFORE

"Framer looks better. Let's use it."

That was me. October 2023. Launching a t-shirt store. 12 designs, 5 sizes (XS-XXL), 4 colors each. Simple enough, right?

Built the site in Framer. Beautiful design. Smooth animations. Product pages looked great.

Then reality hit.

THE PROBLEM

Framer doesn't do product variants

For each t-shirt, I needed 20 separate products (12 designs × 4 colors). Sizes? Had to be separate too.

Math: 12 designs × 5 sizes × 4 colors = 240 separate products

Framer's solution? Create each one manually. 240 product pages. 240 price entries. 240 inventory trackers to update.

Time estimate: 40 hours of data entry. For a 12-design store.

THE FIX

Switched to 10Web + WooCommerce

Rebuilt the store in 10Web. WooCommerce handles variants natively.

Setup:

  • → Created 12 products (one per design)
  • → Added size attribute (5 options)
  • → Added color attribute (4 options)
  • → WooCommerce generated 240 variant combinations automatically

Time: 2 hours total. Inventory tracking works. Price updates work. Customer sees size/color dropdowns.

THE AFTER

THE HARD TRUTH

E-commerce with AI builders that actually works:

1

Product variants make or break e-commerce

12 designs × 5 sizes × 4 colors = 240 variants. Framer can't handle this—you'd need 240 separate products. 10Web + WooCommerce? One product with variant attributes. 2 hours vs 40 hours setup. Choose wrong and you're manually creating products for weeks.

2

Inventory tracking is non-negotiable for real stores

Sell size M, color red? Inventory needs to update across ALL combinations. Framer: manual spreadsheet hell. 10Web: automatic inventory sync. Sell the last medium? All medium variants show out of stock. This isn't optional for stores with more than 5 products.

3

Shipping zones and tax calculation require real e-commerce

Shipping to California? Different rate than New York. Tax in Texas? Different than Oregon. Framer: flat rate only (or manual calculation). 10Web: automatic shipping zones + tax calculation by location. Getting either wrong = overcharging customers or eating margins.

4

Payment gateways matter for conversion

WooCommerce supports 100+ payment gateways. Stripe, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Klarna, Affirm. Framer? Stripe and PayPal only. Want buy-now-pay-later? Want crypto? Want regional payment methods? WooCommerce has them. Framer doesn't.

5

Cart abandonment recovery = found money

70% of shoppers abandon carts. WooCommerce sends automated recovery emails. 10Web supports this out of the box. Result: +24% recovered sales. Framer has no abandonment recovery. That's leaving thousands on the table for stores doing any volume.

6

Discount codes and coupons drive sales

"20% off everything" — WooCommerce handles this automatically. Percentage discounts, fixed amount, free shipping, buy X get Y. Framer? No discount system. You'd have to manually change every product price and change it back. Not sustainable.

7

Simple stores (5 products or less) can use anything

Selling one ebook? One course? One consulting package? Framer works fine. But the moment you have variants, inventory, or more than 5 products—Framer becomes manual labor. Decision rule: 1-5 products, simple variants → any builder. Real store with variants → 10Web + WooCommerce.

The Reality: Most AI Builders Can't Do E-commerce

Only 10Web AI has real e-commerce.

Framer has basic product buttons but no inventory management. Durable has no e-commerce at all. Relume is just wireframes. If you need a real online store with product variants, inventory, shipping zones, and tax calculation—10Web is the only AI builder that delivers.

What About Other AI Builders?

Framer AI: Basic Products Only

Framer can add "buy" buttons but lacks:

  • • No product variants (sizes, colors)
  • • No inventory tracking
  • • No discount codes
  • • No shipping calculation

Verdict: Use Framer if you're selling 1-2 products max. For a real store, it's not enough.

Durable AI: No E-commerce

Durable doesn't have e-commerce features. It's designed for service businesses and lead generation, not online stores.

Verdict: Not suitable for e-commerce.

FAQ: AI Builders for E-commerce

Can I use Framer for an e-commerce store?

Only for very simple stores. Framer works if you're selling 1-5 products with NO variants (sizes, colors). The moment you need product variants (like t-shirts in multiple sizes and colors), Framer fails. You'd need to create each variant as a separate product. 12 designs × 5 sizes × 4 colors = 240 separate products to create manually. Framer doesn't do inventory tracking either. For real e-commerce, use 10Web + WooCommerce.

Which AI website builder is best for e-commerce?

10Web + WooCommerce, by far. 10Web is the only AI builder with full WooCommerce integration. WooCommerce handles product variants, inventory management, shipping zones, tax calculation, discount codes, payment gateways (100+ options), cart abandonment recovery, and everything else a real store needs. Framer? Basic buy buttons only. Durable? No e-commerce at all. For real stores, 10Web is the only choice.

How many products can AI builders handle?

Depends on variants. 10Web + WooCommerce: unlimited products, unlimited variants. Framer: technically unlimited, but manually creating each variant makes it impractical beyond 10-20 products. Durable: no e-commerce at all. The question isn't "how many products" — it's "how complex are your products?" T-shirts with sizes/colors? Go 10Web. Digital downloads (no variants)? Framer works.

Do AI builders support inventory management?

Only 10Web does it properly. 10Web + WooCommerce has full inventory management. Sell a medium red shirt? Inventory updates across ALL red shirts and ALL medium shirts automatically. Framer: no inventory tracking. You'd need a spreadsheet and manual updates. Sell the same item twice? Oops. Over selling = angry customers and refunds. For stores with more than 5 products, inventory management is non-negotiable.

Can I accept payments with AI website builders?

10Web: 100+ payment gateways. Framer: Stripe + PayPal only. WooCommerce supports everything: Stripe, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Klarna, Affirm, Sezzle, Afterpay, crypto, regional payment methods, and 90+ more. Framer supports Stripe and PayPal. That's it. Want buy-now-pay-later? Want crypto? Want local payment methods for international customers? 10Web has them. Framer doesn't. Payment options = conversion. More options = more sales.

What about shipping calculation?

10Web: automatic by zone. Framer: flat rate only. WooCommerce calculates shipping by location, weight, price, or quantity. Shipping to California? One rate. New York? Different rate. International? Different zones. Tax too — calculated automatically by location. Framer: flat rate shipping only (or you charge everyone the same and lose margin on expensive shipments). For real stores, accurate shipping calculation is non-negotiable.

Can I do discount codes with AI builders?

10Web: yes. Framer: no. WooCommerce has full discount and coupon system. Percentage discounts, fixed amount, free shipping, buy X get Y free, product-specific discounts, category discounts, limited time, limited uses, customer limits — everything. Framer has no discount system. Want to run "20% off everything for Black Friday"? You'd have to manually change every product price and change it back later. Not sustainable. For stores that do promotions, 10Web is required.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Most AI builders can't build real e-commerce sites.

Framer has buy buttons. No variants. No inventory. No shipping calculation. No tax calculation. No discount codes. No cart abandonment recovery. For a 5-product digital download store? Fine. For anything real? You're rebuilding in 3 months.

The decision rule isn't complicated:

  • → 1-5 products, no variants, digital only → Framer works
  • → Product variants, inventory tracking, physical products → 10Web required
  • → Discount codes, shipping zones, tax calculation → 10Web required
  • → Cart abandonment recovery, payment flexibility → 10Web required

That's how you avoid the 240-variant nightmare.
That's how you build a store that actually scales.
